page.title: 13S.CROYDON _ SANDERSTEAD
page.content: Sanderstead is a quiet residential area containing a majority of detached houses.Until about a century ago,Sanderstead was mostly woods and fields, and there are still scenic areas such as Croham Hurst,Purley Beeches and the Gruffy.Many wild animals are to be found in Croham Hurst, such foxes, badgers,squirrels rabbits and common woodland birds.The same could be said of Purley Beeches which also contains tennis courts and a large playing field.On the Gruffy there is a pond into which many passers by throw their litter.Once a year the scouts clear it out.The cubs and scouts have an annual Gruffy Fair which has many stalls and an "It's a Knockout" competition.In 1984 Â£2500 was raised.
